sections.title: I am the Lord your God; you shall not have strange gods before me

questions.text: Have I put God first in my daily choices and priorities?
Have I made time for prayer even in a busy home life?
Have I trusted in God's plan for my family, or sought control?
Have I modeled love of God for my children?
Have I turned to other things for comfort instead of God?
Have I encouraged my family to grow in faith?
Have I loved God above all, even in stress or trials?

sections.title: You shall not take the name of the Lord your God in vain

questions.text: Have I spoken God’s name with reverence and respect?
Have I allowed or ignored the misuse of God's name in the home?
Have I expressed frustration using sacred words?
Have I encouraged respectful speech about holy things?
Have I helped my children understand reverence for God?
Have I taken God's name lightly in stories or jokes?
Have I honored God's name in prayer and in correction?

sections.title: Remember to keep holy the Lord’s Day

questions.text: Have I made Sunday a day of worship and rest?
Have I encouraged my family to participate in Mass joyfully?
Have I avoided unnecessary work and focused on family and God?
Have I taught my children the meaning of the Sabbath?
Have I prepared for Sunday so we can worship peacefully?
Have I honored the Lord’s Day beyond just attending Mass?
Have I made Sunday a time of joy, prayer, and renewal?

sections.title: Honor your father and your mother

questions.text: Have I spoken respectfully to and about my parents and in-laws?
Have I taught my children to respect elders through my example?
Have I held grudges or failed to reconcile with family?
Have I valued the wisdom of my parents and their sacrifices?
Have I assisted my parents when in need?
Have I encouraged family unity and respect?
Have I honored those who gave me life and faith?
Have I nurtured anger, resentment, or harsh criticism?
Have I used my words to wound my spouse or children?
Have I practiced gentleness in stressful parenting moments?
Have I shown compassion to the suffering or lonely?
Have I taught my children to value all human life?
Have I forgiven others quickly and taught forgiveness?
Have I responded to tension with prayer or with outburst?
Have I been faithful to my husband in thought, word, and deed?
Have I rejected impure media or distractions?
Have I fostered emotional or spiritual intimacy with my spouse?
Have I taught purity and dignity in love to my children?
Have I respected the sacredness of marriage?
Have I kept appropriate boundaries in all relationships?
Have I turned to God for healing in any struggles with chastity?
Have I respected what belongs to others in the home and community?
Have I managed family finances with honesty and care?
Have I used time well and not wasted what is entrusted to me?
Have I modeled generosity and stewardship for my children?
Have I taken anything unjustly or failed to return borrowed items?
Have I supported the Church and those in need as I am able?
Have I taught my children to honor others’ property?

sections.title: You shall not bear false witness against your neighbor

questions.text: Have I spoken truthfully and kindly about others?
Have I avoided gossip or passing judgment?
Have I defended the dignity of those who are misunderstood?
Have I apologized for any lies or misrepresentations?
Have I taught my children to love truth and honesty?
Have I avoided sarcasm or criticism that harms others?
Have I sought reconciliation when I’ve spoken wrongly?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s wife

questions.text: Have I been envious of other women’s relationships or families?
Have I compared my husband to others unfairly?
Have I fostered unrealistic expectations in marriage?
Have I sought emotional satisfaction outside of my marriage?
Have I embraced the unique strengths of my own family?
Have I respected other women’s marriages with pure intention?
Have I prayed for joy and fidelity in my vocation?

sections.title: You shall not covet your neighbor’s goods

questions.text: Have I compared my home, lifestyle, or possessions to others?
Have I expressed gratitude for what I have?
Have I pressured my spouse for more than is needed?
Have I spent responsibly and modeled contentment?
Have I taught my children to value people over things?
Have I rejoiced in others' blessings without jealousy?
Have I practiced simplicity and detachment with joy?
